Title: Komplexní řešení problémů
Description:
Introduction:

Participants will learn how to approach problems objectively and systematically, with a combination of analytical and creative thinking.

Objectives:

Understanding the internal logic of solving different types of problems
Adoption of procedures for the complete solution of the problem from the beginning when the problem is identified till the final resolution
Introduction to the key analytical techniques for understanding problems and uncovering their essence and training in practice
Introduction to useful and practical creative techniques aimed to find appropriate methods to solve problems and their training
Clarification of the distinction between "finding a solution" and "resolving"
SWOT or team SWOT in relation to problem solving
Specific situations from participant’s practice

Target Group:

Employees in non-managerial positions whose job it is to solve complex problems (both individual and team ones) and who need to acquire the knowledge and basic skills in this area, also managers with specific need in the area of problem solving

Main Topics:

Decision making in problem solving process (key moments in the problem solving process - what, when, how and who decides)
Problem analysis (both traditional and modern methods of problem analysis and clarification of their nature, causes and context: SWOT analysis, Ishikawa, Pareto analysis, stakeholder analysis, Ekotest, PEST analysis, Scenario Planning)
Problem solving (practical tools to find solutions of problems: Disney Strategy, 6 Hats, Balint Technique, Mentors Table, State Line)
Creative and other techniques (other practical tools to find solutions to the problems: different types of brainstorming, dialogue …)

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency ČNP

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words:

business insight, problem solving, analysis, problem solving techniques, competency training, development training, how to analyze and solve problems, analytical thinking, creative approach, decision-making

Description:
Be a Better Neighbor and help us say NO to underage and impaired drinking. You may just save someone's life.

Being a responsible alcohol vendor is our job and our responsibility. We can make someone's day by asking for their ID while we keep our community safe by refusing to sell to minors or visibly impaired customers. It's not always easy, but it's our job to know regulations for:


	The hours of operation for sale of alcoholic beverages
	Storage of alcoholic beverages
	Purchasing, receiving and selling alcholic beverages
	Consumption rules
	Return policy for alcoholic beverages
	RAMP (Responsible Alcohol Management Program) Guidelines:
	Legal implication of selling alcohol to minors
	The acceptable forms of identification
	How to execute proper carding practices (FEAR)
	The difference between visible/legal intoxication and what the Licensee is responsible for
	When the service of alcohol should be stopped (at first sign of impairment)

Title: E-learning Zelfscan

Korte introductie: In deze e-learning leer je de werking van het zelfscan systeem en het bijbehorende gedrag om klanten te benaderen die zelf scannen met de handscanner of hun mobiele telefoon.

Deze opleiding bestaat uit twee delen. Het eerste deel is deze e-learning. Hierin leer je wat de voordelen van Zelfscan zijn, hoe zelfscan werkt (zowel m.b.v. de handscanner en met de mobiele telefoon) en wat jouw werkzaamheden zijn. Het tweede deel van de opleiding bestaat uit praktijkleren. In dit deel word je door je begeleider op de werkvloer opgeleid om zelfstandig alle werkzaamheden die behoren bij zelfscan goed uit te voeren. De takenlijst die je gebruikt voor het praktijkdeel kun je vinden in ELM bij de omschrijving van deze e-learning onder het kopje "verwante documenten". Op Plaza kun je de takenlijst vinden onder tabblad persoonlijk - Leren - Opleidingsmaterialen Caissiere B.

Taal: Nederlands

Aanmeldingsprocedure: Klik op “Naar inhoud” om de e-learning direct op te starten. Om de e-learning op een later moment te volgen, klik je op “toevoegen aan takenlijst”.

Title: Týmová spolupráce (Teamwork)
Description:
Introduction: Do you want to understand yourself better in terms of how you behave at work, in your work team, but also in your family? Are you looking for a way to reinforce the consistency of your team and get the most from mutual cooperation? You will become acquainted with the typical stages of team development and team dynamics. You will learn which team role is closest to you and learn how to assess your colleagues based on the practical typology of team roles. Furthermore you will become acquainted with benefits and risks of different team roles for team performance. The course is interactive (model situations, self-reflection,  exercises, practical application).

Objectives: To understand ourselves and the way we function at work, team, but also in our family, To recognize the benefits and possible risks of our own communication and work styles, Simple personal typology that makes communication with others easier, To learn about characteristics of an effective team, typical stages team development and its dynamics, To map out what are the basic rules for the allocation of tasks within the team, to know the importance of team and individual motivation, Conflicts in teams, how to solve and prevent them; instructions and recommendations to promote mutual respect and tolerance, To set the action plan for me and our team, To try and practice effective teamwork using model situations, To understand the impact of changes in the company on teams and individuals; and to find ways to strengthen communication with others and to improve mutual cooperation as much as possible

Target Group: Teams (newly built, with more new members, or teams in need of setting up new more efficient rules of operation); please be aware that the whole team is the best Target Group for the training not the individual

Main Topics:

Team definition and characteristics of an effective one
Corporate mergers and the impact on corporate culture
Team development stages
Team communication
How to explain efficiently
Team roles
Team conflicts and their solutions
Feedback

Supplier:                                             External training agency TCC

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: team, team cooperation, development training, competency training, change, change management

Title: Franklin Covey: Leaders @ Change
Description:
What is the one thing that is constant in this world? CHANGE.

Organizations don't change, people do and we, as leaders, need to be prepared to help ease our team's journey towards new ways of working in this ever-changing environment. To do that effectively, we need new tools and that's where Leaders@Change can help. Come explore:


	Leading Change
	The Change Mode
	The Five Elements of Change:
	Vision
	Communication
	Alignment
	Engagement
	Accountability


Language: English

Supplier: Internal / External

Location: Varies

Participants: 20-25

Need help? Click here

Keywords: Change Management, Changing, Leadership

Title: Franklin Covey: Meeting Advantage
Description:
In a business world driven by results and performance, you have to make meetings work to your advantage.

Focused meetings don't just happen; they are the result of a well-designed process: Frontload, Focus, and Follow Through. Use this three-step process to define a meeting's purpose, conduct productive meetings, and implement effective follow-through with results.

Language: English

Supplier: Internal / External

Location: Varies

Participants: 20-25

Need help? Click here

Keywords: Communication, Leadership

Title: Franklin Covey: Speed of Trust Foundations
Description:
Trust is the new currency in today's connected, collaborative world and trust begins with you.

Low trust individuals become suspicious and disengaged, resulting in decreased productivity and increased costs. But on high trust teams, individuals are more engaged and communicate openly with each other and that leads to increased productivity and decreased costs. In The Speed of Trust Foundations you'll use real work situations to:


	Practice the 13 Behaviors of High Trust to develop, restore, and extend trust.
	Create a Trust Action Plan to increase personal credibility and influence.
	Practice communicating transparently, respectfully, and directly.
	Identify how to extend appropriate levels of trust with co-workers.
	Improve your track record of keeping commitments through a Peer Accountability Process.


Language: English

Supplier: Internal / External

Location: Varies

Participants: 20-25

Need help? Click here

Keywords: Leadership, Credibility, Communication, Accountability

Title: Franklin Covey: The 5 Choices to Extraordinary Productivity
Description:
Do you feel constantly busy, but the needle never seems to move? Anxious and overwhelmed the minute you hit the start button?

The barrage of information coming at us, coupled with the demands of our careers, is overwhelming. Take this course to discover the three challenges we have to address to stay productive:


	Decision Overload
	Attention Under Attack
	Low Energy Crisis


Then learn how to use five specific tools to overcome these challenges so you can get the right things done without burning out.

Language: English

Supplier: Internal / External

Location: Varies

Participants: 20-25

Need help? Click here

 

Keywords: Communication, Leadership, Collaborate, Goals

Title: Franklin Covey: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People Foundations
Description:
Great performance requires a common set of values, behaviors, and skills that align capabilities to our strategy.

Learn the timeless principles of human effectiveness that propel us toward greater maturity and performance and discover how true success comes from the inside-out through:


	Private Victory - build a foundation of character by focusing on self-management and accepting full responsibility for our choices, moods,actions, and outcomes.
	Public Victory - learn how to work well with others to have a lasting influence and impact by listening and advocating with empathy and respect, and solving problems through synergy.


Then learn how to use five specific tools to overcome these challenges so you can get the right things done without burning out.

Language: English

Supplier: Internal / External

Location: Varies

Participants: 20-25

Need help? Click here

Keywords: Communication, Leadership, Collaborate, Goals

Title: Project management Fundamentals - Awareness
Description:
In a game/simulated environment the participants are confronted with practical, recognizable (problem) situations regarding working in projects. This is used to create awareness of the important project management aspects.

Learning objectives: After this course you have learned the value of project management aspects like Project organization, Business Case, Scope, Quality, Risk, Planning and Control.

Target group: Everyone with an interest in project management, some experience in working in projects, and who want to learn more on the topics described above. 

Pre-requisites: No specific knowledge is required. 

Course Outline: The course will use a simulation of a Family Fun Park to create awareness of aspects that are important for successful completion of projects.  The basic cycle that is used is Plan, Experience, Reflect and Improve. An intake with participants for this training is part of the preparation. The simulation can be varied to accommodate the topics that are relevant to the participants.

Training-agency: www.capgemini-academy.nl

Training method: Instructor lead simulation / game. 
Language: English, Dutch
Type of training: In-company
Duration: 8 hours
Min-max groupsize: 8-12 participants 
Costs: € 450,- to 675- per person, dependent of number of participants. These costs will be charged to the cost center of your department.

Procedure to enroll: This training is organized when the minimum number of participants have been met. Please add this training to your study plan and use the button Request schedule / Rooster aanvragen, to put you on the request list. If the minimum number of participants is met, you will recieve an invitation to register yourself on the planned date/time. If you want this training to be organized for your team, please contact the contact person for this training.

Title: Coaching Project management
Description:
The individual Project Management coaching will use your personal experiences or issues as the topics  for individual coaching sessions, to enhance your professional use of project management and personal skills. 

Learning objectives: This personal coaching is aimed at enhancing the professional use of project management and personal skills by coaching and supporting the participant in daily practice.

Target group: Target audience for this coaching are project managers who run a project and experience some kind of difficulties during their daily work. The sessions can focus on borh management and personal skills.  

Pre-requisites: No specific knowledge is required. 

Course Outline: The coaching can focus on any topic that is connected to project management, e.g.  Scopecreep, Managing the team, resourcing, Changing objectives, Time management, Managing product quality, Conflict handling, Planning, Risk management. The specific topic will be fine-tuned in the discussion between coach and participant.

Training-agency: www.capgemini-academy.nl

Training method: Personal coaching
Language: English, Dutch
Type of training: In-company
Duration: 2 sessions of 2 hours
Min-max groupsize: 1-2 participants 
Costs: € 1125,-. These costs will be charged to the cost center of your department.

Procedure to enroll: This coaching is organized by the participant directly with the coach. Please contact Ahold.Learning@Ahold.com for more details of the coach.

Title: Dale Carnegie - High Impact Presentation
Description:
Whether you are persuading colleagues, selling a client or energizing a team, the power of your presentation makes the difference between success and failure.

The experience in this presentations skills training seminar is as close as you can get to having a personal, public speaking coach. You present at least seven times over the course of two days. Your presentations are videotaped and evaluated. And you get expert one-on-one coaching at the end of each presentation. High-Impact Presentations will benefit managers who have some prior public speaking experience. It is particularly useful for executives who speak in front of groups and sales people. This is a more advanced presentations skills training seminar and is not recommended for those new to public speaking.

Language:  English

Location:  Offsite

Participants: 20 - 25

Title: UAT training
Description:
Algemeen
De training is voor een geselecteerde groep van ETOS medewerkers in het kader van het IRIS project. De training is ter voorbereiding om het testtraject voor de Oracle applicaties uit te kunnen voeren. De cursisten zijn geselecteerd om deze systeemsoftware te gaan testen. 
Leerdoel
Met deze opleiding zijn de cursisten in staat het testen van de systeemsoftware uit te voeren. Wat zij moeten testen en hoe zij moeten testen. 
Ze krijgen daarnaast inzicht in wat software testing inhoudt en raken bekend met de testprincipes en testscenario’s.

Inhoud training
Ter voorbereiding van het testen krijgen zij inzicht in de samenhang tussen de veranderende organisatieprocessen en de nieuwe Oracle applicaties. 
De cursisten krijgen de vaardigheid om te kunnen navigeren door de schermen met behulp van het lesmateriaal (de zogenaamde Storyboards). 
De cursisten leren de schermen te lezen en zelfstandig systeemgerelateerde informatie op te zoeken in de Storyboards. 
De testcoördinator legt uit wat software testing, testprincipes en testscenario's inhouden en zal de weken na de training het testen leiden.

Look at the most successful people in business. They are confident and inspiring. They are empowered to achieve their goals and they are enthusiastic about getting the job done - they are engaged in their work and their life.

This unique three-day critical thinking & problem solving seminar will help you master the skills you need to excel in today's competitive workplace. You'll learn to handle people more professionally and keep pace with fast-changing workplace conditions. After you complete our critical thinking training you'll be equipped to perform as a persuasive communicator, creative workplace problem solver and intelligent risk-taker. The program emphasizes the principles of success and shows you how to put them into action every day.

Title: Data Privacy
Description:
Ben jij je bewuist van het belang van de privicy richtlijnen?

Voor ons bedrijf zijn persoonsgegevens van groot belang, denk bijvoorbeeld aan de data betreffende onze medewerkers (veelal HR en aan data over onze klanten. Europese richtlijnen stellen echter grenzen aan het gebruik van persoonsgegevens. De training ""Data Privacy"" heeft tot doel bewustwording en kennis bijbrengen van de basisprincipes van privacy


Language: Nederlands
Supplier: Legal
Location: ahold locatie
Participants: Iedereen die vanuit zijn functie met persoonsgegevens in aanraking komt, bijvoorbeeld HR Services en HR Business Partners; Marketing, Loyalty, On-line, IT, NFR).

Title: Category Manager Training Program
Description: The purpose of this six month training program is to educate and provide the tools necessary for Associates to become successful Category Managers .  Associates receive instruction from all areas of the business including finance, Category Business Planning, Routine Category Management, Marketing, Advertising, etc.  The Associate must attend all scheduled classes, assigned mentoring program, create, present and execute a Category Business Planning Process.  In order to be accepted in the Category Manager Training Program the Associate must be nominated by their Vice President to attend.

Title: Workshop Organizational design, job discription & evaluation
Description: In this workshop you learn what we mean by Organizational design, Job description & evaluation. You learn how you use the OD methodology in your role as strategic Business partner. We focus on how to make a job description, get insight in job evaluation process and methodology and how to give feedback to the business.

Title: Meyers Chemical Warehouse Training
Description: This training is to ensure that porters have an understanding of how  approved cleaning chemicals work and how to use them safely. The following topics are covered during three .5 hour training sessions:  Where and how to use approved cleaning chemicals; how often to use chemicals; and review of employee safety information.

Title: Records Management Training
Description: Familiarizes associates with the Ahold Records Management Policy and reviews data retention schedules.  The retention schedules  provide associates specific guidance by business function regarding how long to maintain records.

Title: Řízení času
Description:
Brief introduction: Do you sometimes feel that some people manage to do more and better than you? Maybe you noticed that family and hobbies recede into the background before the job responsibilities? Would you like to do something about it? Maybe you could try to better manage yourself and your time.

Objectives: To show examples of causes and consequences of not managing time and tasks or even failure, To focus on the shortcomings in the organization of my own work and to create a working day record, To become familiar with the tools of self-management - time management in the workplace, Repetition of how to set a goal, to focus on it, rehearsing procedures for setting priorities during  planning; and learning to create a feasible task schedule, trying some methods of planning and self-organization in practice, To be able to apply the principles of the importance and urgency in prioritizing; Mapping inefficient or redundant activities, To familiarize with practical tools of  managing work activities, To practice sorting  and delivering tasks during the workday, To focus on dealing  with stress, to recognize how it arises and its impacts, To rehearse basic stress management techniques

Target Group: Employees in non/managerial positions who need to acquire the knowledge and basic skills in time management, or managers with specific training needs in this respective area.

Main Topics: Self-Management, Time management at workplace, Objectives, priorities and tasks, Planning, scheduling tools and practical principles for scheduling, Stress and how to work with it, Training Stress Techniques
Applications to Practice: Setting up an action plan for participants’ development in time management

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency TCC

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: time, the importance and urgency, time management, time management, operational excellence, operational excellence, competency training, development training, stress, stress management techniques, time management

Title: Orientace na zákazníka 1 (Customer Orientation 1)
Description:
Školení umožní účastníkům identifikovat možné cesty ke zlepšení vzájemné spolupráce ve společnosti, vytvářet efektivní vztahy a získávat důvěru a respekt. Součástí je budování společného zájmu a osvojení si základních principů efektivní komunikace s interním i externím zákazníkem.



Rozsah školení:

2 dny bez ubytování





Místo konání:

Praha



Školitel:

školení je realizováno prostřednictvím externí agentury





Definice kompetence (Orientace na zákazníka), která je tímto školením rozvíjena:

"Věnuje se plnění potřeb jak interních, tak externích zákazníků. Poskytuje zákazníkům kvalitní produkty a služby. Naslouchá interním zákazníkům a rozumí jejich potřebám a očekáváním. Při každodenní práci bere v úvahu potřeby zákazníka. Buduje a udržuje efektivní vztahy s interními i externími zákazníky.“

Klíčová slova: Orientace na zákazníka, Zákazník, Customer orientation, Customer, Negotiation, Communication, competency training, kompetenční školení, rozvojové školení

Title: Effectief Leidinggeven bij Verandering
Description:
Deze training ondersteunt de Teamleider in zijn rol als leidinggevende. Het accent ligt op leidinggeven aan verandering. Binnen het programma ligt de focus op Eigen Leiderschap (50%), Omgaan met soorten Weerstand (25%) en het Managen van Verwachtingen (25%). 

Learning objectives: Je leert leiding geven aan teams op moment van veranderingen met impact op de werkzaamheden, rol en/of verantwoordelijkheden van het team.

Target group: Teamleiders

Pre-requisite knowledge: Training Effectief Leidinggeven

Course-outline: Zelf leiderschap, 1-op-1 leiderschap, Teamleiderschap, Organisatieleiderschap, Omgaan met weerstand, Omgaan met verwachtingen

Method: Instructor lead training, with a projectmanagement game.

Language: Dutch

Training-agency: Moovs

Type of training: In-company

Location: Externe lokatie

Duration: 1 dag

Costs: € 8.000,-- per groep. Prijs van totaal traject. De kosten worde geboekt op het kostenplaatsnummer van de betreffende discipline.

Min-max groupsize: 6 - 12 deelnemers .

Procedure to enroll: Please add this training to your studyplan and use the button Register / Registreren to register to one of the available dates. Upon approval of your manager (if applicable) you will receive a confirmation of your registration to this course. However, this confirmation remains preliminary, until the minimum number of participants have applied. Two weeks before the training you will receive a final confirmation including information on the logistics of the training. Cancellations will be accepted until a maximum of 4 weeks prior to the training. After that costs will be charged.

Title: Profesní zralost – Seberozvoj a zvládání změn
Description:
Short introduction: in this course you learn about the change phenomenon, you get acquinted with the curve of reaction to change and personal change. You learn how to distinguish among values, attitudes and competencies. Part of the training are also practical trainings of giving feedback and proper argumentation.

Topics:

- change as a phenomenon, Kaizen methodology

- reaction on change

- valus – attitudes – competencies

- Ahold values

- giving feedback to subordinate

Title: Přehled o oboru 2 (Rozhodování a řešení problémů 2)
Description:
Účastníci se v této pokročilé úrovni učí definovat, analyzovat a řešit problémy a konflikty a osvojovat si techniky, které podporují nalezení správného řešení problémů a tvorbu nových nápadů. Výhodou je, že na toto dvoudenní školení navazuje praktický follow-up workshop, kde si účastníci osvojené znalosti prakticky vyzkouší a získají formou koučinku okamžitou zpětnou vazbu. 

Základní témata: 
- Jak včas rozpoznat a efektivně projednat problém 
- Metody a techniky řešení problémů 
- Porozumění a užití technik pro: stanovování cíků, tvorbu nápadů, výběr možností, plánování 
- Případová studie - řešení problémů a užití probraných technik pro jejich užití 

Rozsah školení: 
2 dny školení+ 1 den workshopu (cca po měsíci)

Místo konání: 
hotel v Praze či blízkém okolí

Školitel: 
školení je realizováno prostřednictvím externí agentury


Část kompetence "Přehled o oboru", která je postihnuta tímto školením: 
„Činí vhodná rozhodnutí a bere v úvahu různé úhly pohledu. Je zdatný/zdatná při získávání a analyzování informací z různých zdrojů. Používá nápady a kreativitu k dosahování výsledků. Vidí skryté problémy a chápe souvislosti mezi jednotlivými událostmi...“

Title: Zákoník práce (Labour code)
Description: Jednodenní seminář je zaměřen na praktické dopady zákoníku práce v praxi. Obsahuje přehled právních předpisů a změn v zákoníku práce a praktická doporučení, příklady a návody k řešení pracovně právních situací, které přináší každodenní praxe v pracovněprávních vztazích.

Title: Leadership Development Program BASIS (LDP BASIS)
Description:
Introduction: Training BASIS LDP is a part of the development program Leadership Development Program (LDP). LDP BASIS is designed for new and existing managers. Specifically, it focuses on basic management tools, leadership and employee evaluation. In this program consisting of three modules, managers undergo diagnostics of their own management style, they learn the basics of managerial work, deepen their knowledge in this field and acquire new skills during training, also through case studies, scenarios, role-plays and feedback.

Objectives: • Clarify the manager´s role and expectations of this position

• Obtain guidance / inspiration for the first steps in a management position

• Get acquainted with basic managerial tools for leading people

• Strengthen your managerial authority

Target Group: Existing managers (both junior and senior), who have needs complementary with the objectives of the training (see above).

Main Topics: Module I: Basic management tools, Setting  management system
Manager and its tools, Expectations´ interviews, Effective communication, Manager´s authority, Setting tasks and targets to employees, Chairing  meetings

Module II: Leadership, Personality styles and professional approaches (Kolb)
Effective teamwork, Motivation, “Is able x wants” typology, Management styles
Motivating people to change

Module III: Evaluation and selection of employees, Performance evaluation
Performance appraisal interviews, Employees´ development, Hiring process, Leading the selection interview, Adaptation of new employees

Duration of Training: 3  modules consisting of 2 days spread over three to six months (range 3-6 months)

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: leadership, leader, management, manager, leadership, leadership development program, performance appraisal, management tools

Title: Focus on ... Ahold Europe Information Management
Description:
In the face of powerful competitive pressures to respond to the increasing dynamics of markets Ahold Europe has realized that information management has become crucial to deliver outstanding retail performance. After a high level theoretical session on Management Information systems  in November 2007 it's time to get inside into information management  within Ahold Europe. Experience how information management  enables differentiation today and how it  supports operational excellence in execution. In this session you will explore how Ahold European information management has defined  its operating model and organisation based on the Ahold Business Strategy and how core retail business processes generate competitive advantages enabled by state of the art information management. 

After the session you can judge the contribution of information management for the Ahold Europe retail organisation. This session qualifies for 2 (C)PE credits. 

About Focus on
In a rapidly changing finance world it’s key to keep yourself up-to-date. The Focus on…sessions facilitate you with diverse knowledge in the broad area of finance. Focus…on sessions are short training sessions that are hosted by Royal Ahold N.V. 
To provide you with the most up-to-date developments we have selected (inter)national recognized experts. Most of the trainers are liaised with Dutch universities or are experienced Ahold experts. We work to a large extent in cöoperation with NIVRA/VERA and all sessions do qualify for (C)PE credits.

Title: Prezentační dovednosti – Jak vystoupit, zaujmout a prodat
Description:
Introduction: Participants will learn the basic fundamentals of presentation and communication skills, ie. how to prepare a presentation,  how to communicate properly, how to approach different kinds of auditorium, how to deal with objections and inquiries; and last but not least how to give and receive feedback.

Objectives: Developing presentation skills of the participants
Participants will they learn how their appearance and non-verbal communication affect presentation success, as well as how to properly structure a presentation, how to choose  how, when and what should we communicate to keep their audience's attention.
Ways of working with demanding audience
To learn how to work with feedback

Target Group: Employees in non-managerial positions who need to acquire basic presentation skills and knowledge, and also managers with specific training needs in this area.

Main Topics: Selfpresentation
Nonverbal Communication
Structure of the presentation
Techniques used to maintain the audience’s attention
Audience typology
Feedback - accepting and giving one

Duration of the training:         2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency MotivP

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: The influence and impact, Impact and Influence, presentation skills, objection, competency training, development training, communication, presentation, feedback

Title: Finanční řízení pro nefinančníky (Finance for nonfinanciers)
Description:
Základní témata:

Toto půldenní školení má za cíl přiblížit nefinančníkům základní funkce finančního oddělení Aholdu, popsat základní finanční procesy, definovat klíčové finanční pojmy a seznámit se důkladněji s dvěma základními typy finančních výkazů.

Title: Projektové řízení (Project Management)
Description:
Projektové řízení Prince 2 se skládá z teorie a praktických cvičení, které jsou nastaveny na konkrétní příklady projektů samotných studentů.

- OGSM metodologie v Aholdu 
- Co je potřeba vědět před rozběhem projektu a jak vybudovat jeho organizaci
- Jaká je role projektového manažera a ostatních projektových členů
- Jak se projekt rozděluje na etapy (stages) a jak se řídí následující etapy 
- Jak si projektový manažer zajišťuje informovanost o postupu prací
- Jak týmoví manažeři předávají vytvořené produkty projektovému manažerovi
- Jak projektový manažer řídí problémy (issues) a rizika
- Co musí projektový manažer udělat při přípravě uzavření projektu

Title: Základy vyjednávání
Description:
Tento kurz je určen pro zaměstnance centrály, kteří v rámci své pozice aktivně a často vyjednávají s třetími stranami. Dozvíte se základní principy řešení sporů, vyjednávací styly, strategické aspekty vyjednávání



Základní témata:

- základní principy řešení sporů

- zvládání emocí při vyjednávání

- zájmy a postoje při vyjednávání

- základní vyjednávací styly

- příprava na vyjednávání

- strategické aspekty vyjednávání



Rozsah školení:

2 dny bez ubytování



Místo konání:

Praha



Školitel:

školení je realizováno prostřednictvím externí agentury



Definice kompetence (vyjednávání), která je tímto školením rozvíjena:

"Ovlivňuje ostatní z manažerské i nemanažerské pozice. Dokáže přesvědčit věcnými argumenty a různými způsoby. Komunikuje věcně, výstižně, včas a způsobem vhodným pro cílové posluchače.“

 

Klíčová slova:

rozvojové školení, spor, postoj, vyjednávací styl, obchod, dohoda

Title: Vyjednávání pro zaměstnance M,F&M 1
Description:
V tréninkových programech, zaměřených na vyjednávání v obchodě, se soustřeďujeme na ověření základních znalostí a dovedností a velmi rychle směřujeme k pokročilým vyjednávacím disciplínám, zejména potom ke strategickým tématům (jak kombinovat vyjednávací styly), přípravě na vyjednávání, analýze moci a zájmů, sebepoznání a zvládání stresu a - to zcela nejvíce - poznávání partnerů z hlediska jejich osobnosti, myšlení, dovedností a návyků, analýze jejich neverbální komunikace a využití těchto znalostí a dovedností v obchodní praxi. A pochopitelně nácvik vyjednávání v praxi na praktických příkladech, včetně zvládání vybraných obtížných situací.

Průběh školení: 
Poznávání a ovlivňování lidí, zájmů a mocenských aspektů vyjednávání
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich motivů, hodnot a zájmů
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich komunikačních, vztahových a vyjednávacích preferencí
- Sebepoznání a důsledky sebepoznání pro vyjednávání s partnery různých zaměření
- Příprava na vyjednávání, analýza moci a zájmů, definice vyjednávacího prostoru
- Stanovení vyjednávacích taktik a tvorba alternativních scénářů
- Práce s tlakem a informacemi, získávání informací od protistrany

Vyjednávání v nezvyklých a obtížných podmínkách
- Vyjednávání v nerovných podmínkách (včetně vyjednávání v podmínkách dominance)
- Zvládání konfliktních a problémových typů vyjednavačů
- Analýza neverbální komunikace, poznávání a zvládání vyjednávacích triků
- Strategické cíle a strategicky výhodný styl vyjednávání
- Kombinace vyjednávacích stylů s cílem nastavit strategicky výhodný typ vztahů
- Zvládání zátěže a stresu při vyjednávání v obtížných podmínkách

Title: Learning Microsoft SQL Server 2016
Description:
SQL Server can be intimidating, especially for people who have never worked with databases before. A quick overview can go a long way to making you feel more comfortable digging into its powerful capabilities.

This course introduces the most important features of SQL Server 2016, and is designed to act as the student's very first look at how the server operates. Adam Wilbert shows how to install a local copy of SQL Server; demonstrates the working environment, SQL Server Management Studio; and walks students through their first hour creating tables, defining relationships, and writing and running queries with Transact-SQL commands. Everything you need to accomplish to create your first database is covered in just 80 minutes. Start watching to get up and running with this professional-grade database management system.

Title: Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Essential Training
Description: SQL Server supports mission-critical applications and big data solutions—without having to buy expensive add-ons or high-end appliances. Learn the essentials of Microsoft's latest release, SQL Server 2016. Use tools like SQL Management Studio and the Configuration Monitor to deploy and manage databases both on premises and in the cloud. Learn how to create new databases, build tables, define relationships, write queries, and use stored procedures and built-in functions. Instructor Martin Guidry—a SQL Server veteran—also shows how to manipulate XML and JSON data, and perform crucial database administration tasks, such as backups and restores, security enhancements, and performance monitoring. Plus, find out how to extend SQL Server by integrating it with cloud services like Microsoft Azure.

Title: Designing Database Solutions for SQL Server 2016
Description:
When you're working with a team to design a SQL Server 2016 database solution for your organization, there are certain advanced concepts you need to know. In this course, Adam Wilbert introduces you to some of the concepts you'll need to design elegant database solutions that set up your team for success. He covers how to prepare the server for efficient usage, use backup strategies to minimize the impact of a failure, and follow security concepts to ensure users are granted the appropriate permissions for their roles. Plus, Adam covers some of the optimization strategies you can implement in SQL Server to help the system run smoothly in the future.

This course maps to the Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Data Platform exam, Designing Database Solutions for SQL Server. If you're planning on taking this exam, this course is a good place to start your test preparation.

Title: Microsoft SQL Server 2016: Query Data
Description: Many of the world's most powerful programs and websites use SQL to manage the incredible amount of data they work with on a daily basis. As a result, understanding how to query data from platforms like Microsoft SQL Server 2016 is a highly valuable skill. In this course, Gerry O'Brien reviews the history of SQL and relational theory to help you understand exactly where this data manipulation language and the Microsoft seminal database program got their starts. Next, he shows how to query one or many different tables using SELECT statements, as well as how to filter, group, and sort the results. Then, he demonstrates how to work with special data types like dates, times, and characters. Gerry also covers advanced topics like subqueries, programming with Transact-SQL, and improving query performance.

Title: Developing Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Databases
Description:
SQL Server is Microsoft's de facto relational database software. While you can build a simple database relatively easily straight out of the box, most administrators need to know how to take advantage of more advanced features in the latest release, SQL Server 2016, to give their clients everything they've come to expect in an enterprise database. In this course, Adam Wilbert shows experienced SQL Server DBAs how to develop a SQL Server 2016 database. Learn how to create data tables, including temporary tables and tables with variables, and schemas. Find out how to enforce data integrity with constraints and secure your database at the user level. Then discover how to create indexes to optimize performance, work with functions, and make sure your SQL database is as fast and secure as possible.

Note: This course will also help you prepare for the Developing Microsoft SQL Server Databases exam—a crucial component of the MCSA: Solutions Associate certification. Find out more about the certification at https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/learning/exam-70-762.aspx.

Title: Microsoft SQL Server 2016: Installation and Administration
Description:
SQL Server is the database used with Azure and many on-premises environments and is quickly becoming a very popular RDBMS. Get an overview of installing, administering, and managing SQL Server 2016 in this course with SQL Server expert Gerry O'Brien. Learn how to install the database and tools, configure different instances, optimize performance, and secure your database with user roles and logins. Gerry also covers administrative duties such as backup and restoration, database migration, and high-availability options, including database replication, log shipping, and always-on availability.

This course is also ideal for anybody preparing for the Administering a SQL Database Infrastructure (70-764) exam, one of two exams necessary to earn an MCSA: SQL 2016 Database Administration certification.

Title: Installing SQL Server 2012
Description: Learn how to install, secure, and maintain SQL Server 2012. This course is designed to teach new database administrators how to choose the correct SQL Server edition, install it using the GUI or from the command prompt, configure services and network connections, and create and connect to databases. Author Gerry O'Brien also reviews critical backup and restore procedures.

Title: SQL Server 2012 New Features
Description: SQL Server 2012 is the first cloud-ready information platform for Microsoft. In this course, author Martin Guidry explores its new possibilities, showing you how to protect, unlock, and scale the power of your data, and work with a variety of devices and data sources. The course also provides an overview on obtaining, installing, and running SQL Server 2012 and will be of immense interest to anyone considering upgrading or installing this latest edition.

Title: Implementing a Data Warehouse with Microsoft SQL Server 2012
Description: Learn how to design and implement an enterprise data warehouse. Microsoft Certified Trainer Martin Guidry shows how to design fact and dimension tables using both the star and snowflake techniques, use data quality services to cleanse data, and implement an ETL process with SQL Server integration services.

Title: Securing SQL Server 2012
Description: Make sure your network's SQL Servers are secure, using best practices for physical, instance, network, and file system security. Gerry O'Brien introduces basics like SQL Server securables, principals, logins, users, and roles. Then learn how SQL Server checks permissions and use that information to create accounts and assign logins and roles. Last, Gerry explains common network security risks and steps you can take to secure network protocols.

Title: SQL Server 2012: Designing Database Solutions
Description: Learn how to design databases, secure databases, and keep them in tip-top shape, with SQL Server 2012. Join Martin Guidry in this course, as he reviews each step in the process: from designing the infrastructure, a logical schema, and execution plan for the physical hardware, to using indexes to fine-tune performance and implementing policy-based management. He explains best practices for database design, shows where developers can bend the rules, and introduces techniques to manage your database throughout its lifecycle with PowerShell and other monitoring tools.

Title: Querying Microsoft SQL Server 2012
Description: Learn how to query data from SQL Server tables. Microsoft Certified Trainer Gerry O'Brien reviews the history of SQL and relational theory, so you'll understand exactly where this data manipulation language, and Microsoft's seminal database program, got their starts. Then he shows how to query one or many different tables using SELECT statements, and filter, group, and sort the results. Next, learn how to work with special data types like dates, times, and characters. Gerry also covers advanced topics like subqueries, programming with T-SQL (Microsoft's proprietary extension for SQL), and improving query performance.

Title: SketchUp 2017 Essential Training
Description:
SketchUp is a free and easy-to-use 3D drawing, design, and rendering program. SketchUp 2017 offers faster performance, intelligent tools such as smart offsets and inferencing, and more customization options than ever before. Learn the essentials of the latest version of SketchUp in this course. George Maestri covers navigating around the interface, manipulating objects, drawing in 2D and 3D space, working with materials, and applying textures. Plus, learn how to work with reusable components (including third-party objects from the 3D Warehouse) and apply simple styles and animation to make your 3D projects more polished and presentable.

Note: The core features of SketchUp Make, the free version of SketchUp covered in this course, and SketchUp Pro, the paid version of the program, are identical. Users of both versions should be able to follow along with the training.

Title: Leadership Blind Spots
Description:
Have you found yourself mired in a career rut, even though you've worked tirelessly to position yourself as a leader? If so, there may be factors that you're unaware of that are holding you back from being seen as leadership material. In this course, learn how to identify the hidden roadblocks—or blind spots—that are holding you back, and manage them in order to accelerate your career growth.

Instructor Sara Canaday dives into the nuances of blind spots, explaining why blind spots matter when it comes to career success, and which intangible skills can help you find and eliminate these roadblocks. Sara also covers ways to find and close the gaps between your perception of yourself and your reputation. She explores specific examples of leadership blind spots commonly seen in the business world and provides steps that you can take to mitigate your perception problems.

Lynda.com is a PMI Registered Education Provider. This course qualifies for professional development units (PDUs). To view the activity and PDU details for this course, click here.

The PMI Registered Education Provider logo is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

Title: Managing Up
Description:
Are you ready to take charge, do good work, and get noticed for it? If you don't manage up, you may never have the opportunity to manage down. This course is designed to help you learn how to maximize your career by managing up. Leadership consultant and best-selling author Roberta Matuson explains what managing up is, what it isn't, and why it is important to achieving success. First, she helps you decipher the management style of your boss. Then she outlines techniques for building a strong relationship as well as how to avoid mistakes. She also addresses the need to master office politics, how to navigate your workplace effectively, and how to boost your performance by maximizing your personal and positional power.

Lynda.com is a PMI Registered Education Provider. This course qualifies for professional development units (PDUs). To view the activity and PDU details for this course, click here.

The PMI Registered Education Provider logo is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

Title: Finding a Sponsor
Description:
In our competitive workforce, it's crucial that you stand out from the other candidates vying for the same opportunities. Sponsors—individuals within an organization who see your potential and point you in the right direction—can help you define your personal brand and act as your advocate. In this course, executive coach Simon T. Bailey explains how sponsors can guide you along in your career. Learn about the differences between sponsors and mentors and discover how to assess and clarify your career goals, so you can choose the most appropriate sponsor. Once you identify and secure a sponsor, see how you can build a trusting relationship and continue to learn from them and their sphere of influence as you grow your career.

Lynda.com is a PMI Registered Education Provider. This course qualifies for professional development units (PDUs). To view the activity and PDU details for this course, click here.

The PMI Registered Education Provider logo is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

Title: Learning to Be Assertive
Description: We all get frustrated when we feel taken advantage of, or alternatively, respond too aggressively when we feel provoked or trapped. Overcome these knee-jerk responses by learning how to be assertive. This course reveals what assertiveness really means, and how it is different from aggression, and outlines specific techniques you can use to respond to challenging situations and difficult people.

Title: Dealing with a Difficult Boss
Description: Author and professional coach Todd Dewett helps you address the challenge of working with a difficult boss by helping you identify, understand, and manage the triggers that contribute to your problematic relationship. He also outlines actions you can take, such as correctly documenting events, knowing when to speak up, and—sometimes—not taking any action at all.

Title: Business Writing
Description:
"This course is designed to improve your written communication skills including proper grammar and message structure. 

Learning objectives for the course include: identify personal strengths and needs improvement areas related to business writing; learn and practice techniques to write with greater effectiveness, efficiency, and confidence; learn how to create written correspondence that is clear and grammatically correct; identify how to focus on purpose, audience, content and organization when writing business memos; create sample memos that are reviewed by experts; and receive specific feedback to increase the effectiveness of your writing style."

Title: AHOLD Values
Description: Ahold Values

Title: Clozapine REMS Training
Description:
Working in our Pharmacy comes with a lot of responsibility and part of that is knowing about policies and procedures related to specific pharmaceuticals.

Having a clear understanding of this information will help you protect yourself, the company, and the customer and keep everyone living healthy. We can minimize the risk of severe neutropenia associated with the use of Clozapine by keeping prescribers, pharmacists and customers informed.

Language:  English

Need help? Click here.

Title: Category Business Planning
Description:
Category business planning is an essential process to ensure ample product, in both quantity and variety, is available at our stores. 

Increase your knowledge in the strategic management of product groups and customising product offerings on a store by store basis in order to satisfy customer demands.

Title: Sanofi US Pharmacovigilance Adverse Drug Experience Reporting Overview
Description:
The health and wellness of our customers is of the utmost importance in our store pharmacies.

For that reason, it is critical that all Pharmacists understand adverse drug experiences and the impacts they can have on our customers and our business. This includes knowing:


	The meaning of adverse drug experience
	The reason for communicating adverse drug experiences
	Reporting requirements and the timeframe for reporting
	Your role as a Sanofi contractor
	The types of information you will be asked to communicate
	Who to contact and how to contact them


Language:  English

Need help? Click here.

Title: Coaching for Success
Description:
"This course focuses on all aspects of coaching and how it impacts our associates and our business.

Learning objectives for the course include: discuss how changes impact the marketplace and our business; define what coaching is and is not; review the benefits and barriers to coaching; explain and describe how to coach effectively; demonstrate how to measure your successes in coaching; define how to motivate different age groups; discuss the importance of feedback; and describe the importance of assessing our leadership behaviors."

Title: Social Media Guidelines Policy 2011
Description: This course aids Associates in understanding our guidelines and policy when engaging in social media or networking activities at work or at home.

Title: Follow up Advanced Negotiation: The complete Skill
Description:
Workshop Objectives:
By the end of this workshop, you will have completed the following: 
•Recap on negotiation strategies. 
•Complete further case studies enabling you to practice and reflect on appropriate negotiation behaviors. 
•Use a range of planning tools to help maximize negotiations 
•Review of your current relative strengths and weaknesses as a negotiator. 
•Receive feedback to help you to develop your forward plan. 

Workshop Outline:
•Program overview – Delegate performance to date presentation.
•Review performances from the original workshop. 
•Review of negotiation strategies. 
•Practice through a Single-issue negotiation. 
•Analysis of behaviors exhibited during conflict.
•Case 2 – team case on partnership negotiation, and concession trading.
•Analysis of performance 
•Self-assessment /forward planning 

Target group: 
Ahold European Sourcing: All Sourcing Departments: Jobpositions: ESD, sr. ESM, ESM (with at least a year purchasing experience)
Merchandise: Lead CAM’s, CAM’s (with at least a year purchasing experience)

Method: Instructor lead training with case studies. Individual follow-up after three months with interview and self assessment and a one day follow-up workshop with participants as a group.
Language: English or Dutch (depending on participants)
Training-agency: www.thegappartnership.com
Type of training: in-company 
Duration: 1 day (follow-up)
Min-max groupsize: 12 participants 

Procedure to enroll: Please add this training to your individual recurring course and register to one of the available dates. Upon approval of your line manager (if applicable) you will receive a confirmation of your registration to this course. However, this confirmation remains preliminary, until a sufficient number of participants have applied. X-weeks before the training you will receive a final confirmation including information on the logistics of the training.

Title: Satisfying DEA Standards When Dispensing Controlled Substances
Description:
The health and wellness of our customers is of the utmost importance in our store pharmacies. 

For that reason, it is critical that all Pharmacists understand what controlled substances are, the dangers they can present, and how to manage their disbursement effectively and within company and legal regulation. To support your compliance and your ability to satisfy the Pharmacist's responsibilities, this program will prepare you to:


	Describe your obligations as a Pharmacist regarding the dispensing of controlled substances
	Explain the DEA's "corresponding responsibility" rule and expectations of Pharmacists
	Identify typical "red flags" that may indicate a prescription for controlled substances was not issued for a legitimate medical purpose
	Recognize situations that require special attention
	Explain appropriate actions that can resolve red flags
	Locate and access tools and resources to help you satisfy your legal obligations.


Language:  English

Need help? Click here.

Description:
The health and wellness of our customers is of the utmost importance in our store pharmacies. 

For that reason, it is critical that all Pharmacists understand what controlled substances are, the dangers they can present, and how to manage their disbursement effectively and within company and legal regulation. To support your compliance and your ability to satisfy the Pharmacist's responsibilities, this program will prepare you to:

	Recognize situations that require special attention

Title: Code of Ethics - Classroom
Description:
"There has been a dramatic increase in the ethical expectations of businesses over the past several years and increasingly, customers, clients and associates need definition of the day to day operational ground rules. Hence, a Code of Ethics is a standard component most businesses today. This course will clarify the Ahold Code of Ethics policy with explanation and examples.  

Topics include: reviewing the Ahold USA Code, including the topics of antitrust and conflicts of interest; giving and receiving gifts; attending events; participating in sales contests, and appropriately using company assets. The course also discusses the Ahold Global Code, the Electronic Communications and Information Security policy, and the Check-In Line."

Title: Nutrition for Pharmacists
Description:
As Pharmacists, we can offer our customers seeking a healthier lifestyle, more than just what they can get over the counter.

In fact, our pharmacies can be a one stop shop for all things wellness, but that means Pharmacists need to be knowledgeable about health and nutrition. This course provides just what our Pharmacists need to provide nutritional information to our customers and respond to their nutrition-related questions and concerns.

Language:  English

Need help? Click here.

Title: Closer OJT
Description:
"The on-the-job Closer training program will teach associates the proper process, procedures, guidelines, regulations, and responsibilities involved with closing a store at the end of a  business day.

Learning objectives include: delegating tasks appropriately to front end associates based on job descriptions, responding to the needs of the front end, closing procedures, responding to the needs of the store as the manager-in-charge, providing exceptional service and product quality, resolving basic file maintenance issues, identifying store associates as minors through proper dress code (i.e. name badges), enforcing compactor and equipment use regulations, and complying with company and government policies"

Description:

Title: On the job: Electrical pallet newcomer (Logistics)
Communication and Listening
Description:
"This course is designed to equip associates with the skills needed to communicate clearly and listen carefully.

Learning objectives for the course include: assess listening skills and practice effective listening techniques; explore how to manage nonverbal communication; explore the importance of a “sender” using questions and disclosing information; review methods of communication and the strengths and limitations of each; learn how to send and receive clear, accurate messages;  manage internal and external distractions that can interfere with communication; manage the nonverbal messages that they send and receive; and match the appropriate method of communication to their message."

Title: Expert ondersteuning Diversey
Description:
Korte introductie: Kwaliteitsmedewerkers die structureel hoog scoren bij Diversey, bieden we de mogelijkheid om zich verder te ontwikkelen en "expert" te worden. We belonen hiermee de medewerkers die de basis op orde hebben en klaar zijn voor "the next level".
Een consultant van Diversey loopt samen met de kwaliteitsmedewerker en de teamleider een winkelronde en bekijken de kritische punten stapsgewijs. De consultant geeft toelichting en tips aan de kwaliteitsmedewerker en de teamleider. Aan het einde van de winkelronde bespreken jullie met elkaar de bevindingen.
Bereid je goed voor op de komst van Diversey. Bespreek met je teamleider welke vragen je wilt stellen en op welke gebieden je meer informatie wilt.

Voorwaarden om deel te nemen zijn:
- De winkel scoort structureel (minstens 3x opeenvolgend) een "blauwe" score.
- De laatste score van Diversey is minimaal 95%.
- In de "Scan kwaliteitsmedewerker" zijn er minimaal 28 van de 34 punten met "ja" beantwoord.
- De OM kan jaarlijks van zijn winkelgroep maximaal 2 winkels hiervoor aanmelden.

Taal: Nederlands

Leverancier: Diversey

Locatie: Ahold locatie (winkel)

Overnachting: Nee

Kosten: € 150,-- per winkelronde. Voor franchise worden deze doorbelast, voor de eigen winkels niet.

Aanmeldingsprocedure: De OM meldt een winkel hiervoor aan d.m.v. een e-mail aan ahold.learning@ahold.com met daarin de volgende gegevens: winkelnummer, naam en telefoonnummer SM. Diversey neemt vervolgens contact op met de SM om de winkelronde in te plannen. Alle deelnemers aan de winkelronde (KM, TL, (A)SM) krijgen deze activiteit op hun studiehistorie in ELM.

Trefwoorden: Kwaliteit, up-to-date kwaliteitsmedewerker, diversey, diversy

Title: Pick Up Point Associate Training
Description:
Technological advancement, such as our Peapod Pick Up service, creates a Better Place to Shop for our customers. 

Peapod Pick Up (PUP) is a service that allows our customers the convenience of online shopping so they can select their items and schedule a pick up time and location that best suites their needs. As a PUP Associate, your engagement and assistance with our customers' orders will keep them smiling and returning back for more!

Prerequisite: None

Language:  English

Need help? Click here.

Keywords: Peapod, PUP, Home delivery, online, technology, convenience

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Correcting Performance Problems: Addressing Performance Problems
Description:
In Correcting Performance Problems: Addressing Performance Problems, you will learn a process for conducting effective feedback sessions with employees who have a performance problems. You will also learn guidelines for explaining to employees the impact of their problem behavior. In addition, you will learn the correct way to address negative employee responses, as well as how to respond when to employee reactions such as denial, excuses, and shifting blame.

(2 Hours)

Title: Conflict Resolution
Description:
Explore techniques to productively and effectively prevent and resolve conflict.

Learning objectives:


	learn the four tactics for conflict resolution
	learn how to turn conflict into collaboration
	practice skills for resolving conflict through group activities and discussions
	explore ways to resolve conflict by using appropriate tactics to address difficult situations
	learn how to meet the personal and practical needs of others while resolving conflict.


Keywords:  conflict resolution, collaboration, difficult situations

Title: New York Metro New Hire Orientation Acknowledgment
Description: New York Metro New Hire Orientation Acknowledgment. This module should be complete by all newly hired associates once they have attended orientation.

Title: Decision Making
Description:
"This course focuses on thinking strategically about making decisions; the impact decisions can have on associates and the organization, and how to deal with wrong decisions. 

Learning objectives for the course include: discuss the basics of strategic thinking and how to analyze issues, discuss factors outside the company that influence decisions, recognize how decisions have broad implications on issues, learn how to deal constructively with wrong decisions, learn how modeling honest communication influences decisions, identify how to capitalize on opportunities using strategic thinking, and discuss how to apply strategic thinking to decision making."

Title: Customer Service Manager OJT
Description:
"The Customer Service Manager on-the-job training program outlines the process, procedures, and responsibilities of a Customer Service Managers. This training includes in-store hands-on experiences followed by a series of assessments called Knowledge Checks and Performance Checks.

Learning objectives for the program include: perform the Assistant Store Manager job functions, promote and deliver excellent customer service, provide management oversight on key store activities, drive sales and manage gross profits, maintain outstanding sanitation, safety, and security, and perform overall Store Management activities (when in charge of the store)."

Title: Western Union AMLCP Cash Office refresher
Description:
This course is designed for Cash Office Associates. 
The purpose of this course is to ensure compliance with the US Patriot Act which includes any money transfers and money order sales and also to maintain a common training program amongst the Divisions. Any violations of this program could subject our company and associates to severe criminal and civil penalties and could seriously damage the good name of our stores and company.

Title: Western Union AMLCP Service Center refresher
Description:
This course is designed for Service Center Associates. 
The purpose of this course is to ensure compliance with the US Patriot Act which includes any money transfers and money order sales and also to maintain a common training program amongst the Divisions. Any violations of this program could subject our company and associates to severe criminal and civil penalties and could seriously damage the good name of our stores and company.

Title: Diversity
Description:
"This course explains the need for diversity in the workplace, the effects of exclusion on associates and the organization, and the skills and behaviors needed to manage a diverse workforce.

Learning objectives for the course include: understand why diversity is fundamental to leaders and to the company; identify the feelings that go along with being “excluded” or “different”; develop an understanding of how diversity affects attraction, recruitment, and retention of associates; learn what barriers may exist to effectively manage a diverse workforce and customer base; learn about the legal definitions of unlawful harassment; discuss techniques to communicate responsibly with associates and customers; and apply techniques related to the attraction, recruiting, and retention of diverse associates."

Title: Lazanda Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS)
Description: This educational program is about Lazanda® (fentanyl) nasal spray, a medication used in the treatment of pain in opoid-tolerant patients.  Pharmacists are required to complete this training before dispensing this medication.

Title: District Manager Exchange - Inventory Management
Description: Learning objectives for the course include: effectively identify shrink and inventory level issues, causes and opportunities by using reports and visual observation; develop a strategy and plan for better inventory management; and implement best practices to manage inventory through people, processes, reports, and management focus.

Title: Vehicles: Train the trainer electrical palet (Logistics)
District Manager Exchange - Merchandising for Profit
Description: Learning objectives for the course include: teach others to effectively execute the Sales Plan; learn how to enhance impact through creativity; and influence store and department managers to merchandise and drive sales effectively by building on current industry trends, meeting or exceeding customer needs, succeeding against the competition, leveraging Company capabilities, and applying principles of product, price, promotion and place.

Description:
With Google Apps - Personal Training you as individual have the opportunity to have your own online 1 on 1 contact with a Google Apps consultant who can help you working with Mail, Calendar, Chat, Tasks, Docs and Sites within the Ahold environment. This program is also available for groups or departments in sessions of 3 hours on-site.

Target group: all persons who have access to Ahold Google applications

Pre-requisites: Not relevant.

• Get tips&trics from experts
• Choose a combination from Mail, Calendar, Chat, Tasks, Documents, Sites
• Coaching how to work with Google tools

Training-agency: CoShare

Title: District Manager Exchange - Time Management
Description: Learning objectives for the course include: identify ways to better organize your time; learn how to prioritize personal and professional events; understand the best way to leverage people, technology, and processes to operate more efficiently; and identify and effectively deal with time robbers.

Title: 1 Day Food Safety Manager Certification Training
Description:
Why do we need to review food safety and sanitation policies and procedures? Simple! To protect our customers.

Learn about the concepts of food safety and sanitation - It'spart of doing what's right for our customer! This training and certification class meets all requirements of the state and local boards of health.

Description: Tikosyn Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy Training

Title: Handling Workplace Change as an Associate
Facilitating Change
Description:
"This course shows leaders how to make change a positive experience by focusing on a shared vision, building business partnerships, championing ongoing improvement, and creating an environment in which learning is encouraged.

Learning objectives for the course include: explore how organizational change affects a leader’s role, learn the predictable phases of change and strategies for managing them, identify and practice the four roles for leading in an environment of change, develop a clear set of priorities for the leader’s role, learn how to help others feel more comfortable with change, establish greater role clarity for participants and others, and plan actions to achieve an organization’s vision, champion continuous improvement and build business partnerships."

Title: Fuel Workshop for Store Management
Description:
You have to know a lot to work at one of our fuel stations and you have to know even more to manage one.

You will be scheduled for this workshop as soon as one is available. Workshops are conducted quarterly by the Fuel Specialists to provide managers the details they need to know in order to successfully manage the fuel station. This includes:


	Regulatory / Compliance Requirements
	Fuel Plus One
	Fuel Facility Amenities & Overall Appearance
	Customer Engagement
	Supply Chain
	P&L
	Safety & Security


Language: English

Need help? Click here
Keywords: fuel regulations, fuel management

Title: Handling Workplace Change as an Employee
Description: Workplace change is hard. In this course, Chris Croft explains why we struggle with change, and shares many practical techniques that can help you manage—and even thrive—in a world of constant change. Chris begins the course with general overview of change, explaining why most of us dislike it and how to prepare for the changes you'll inevitably encounter throughout your life. Next, he outlines five common types of workplace change—restructuring, layoffs, new initiatives, starting a new role in a team, and getting off to a good start with a new boss—and provides strategies for dealing with each. Even as he addresses particular types of workplace change, Chris shares helpful techniques that could easily apply to other changes in your life.

Title: Communicating in Times of Change
Description:
Leadership communication is never more important than during times of change. This course helps supervisors and mid-level managers come up with a communication strategy that helps make a change initiative successful regardless of whether they are the ones instigating the change. Join communication experts Tatiana Kolovou and Brenda Bailey-Hughes as they address the who, why, when, how, and what of change.

Tatiana and Brenda begin by reviewing success stories and survey data that emphasize why communication in times of change is so crucial. Next, they explain how to strategize communication efforts, craft the change communication message, and answer common questions that people may have when grappling with change. To wrap up, they discuss how to manage difficult questions, emphasize with others, and overcome resistance.

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Business Code of Conduct - Sarbanes - Oxley Act
Description:
This course provides an awareness of Sarbanes-Oxley and the importance of management's overall responsibilities.

(1 Hour)

Title: Feedback Fundamentals
Description:
"This course teaches how to learn and build involvement through the use of feedback.
 
Learning objectives for the course include: learn to seek, receive, and give complete and specific feedback; encourage people to give objective, specific, and complete feedback; practice giving and receiving feedback in specific situations on the job; deliver feedback in an effective manner; receive and use feedback more effectively; and enhance coworkers’ performance by providing them with specific feedback."

Title: Finance 101 for Store Operations
Description:
"This course is designed to equip associates with knowledge about basic financial management; the flow of capital, and controlling operating expenses needed to drive profitability.

Learning objectives for the course include: learn the fundamentals of finance; learn the four drivers of operating efficiency along with important financial statements (income statement and balance sheet); discuss and learn financial terminology such as SG&A, NOPAT and Working Capital; learn how to speak the language of business in a meaningful, results-producing way with your associates; demonstrate how cash transactions are recorded on the income statement and how assets are accounted for the balance sheet; and identify ways to drive operating earnings and manage capital efficiency."

Title: Finance 101 for Supply Chain Operations Managers
Description:
"The purpose of this course is to improve the understanding of how financials are handled in each specific distribution center, discuss how expenses can be controlled within all facilities, and explain how distribution center leaders can work together to improve cost management.

Topics include: looking at the financial big picture, key performance indicators for managing a business, reviewing and interpreting reports, and taking accountability."

Description:

Topics include: merchant orientation for all associates, orientation to the position, merchandising, supply chain, replenishment, and personal development."

Title: Organisatieleiderschap voor de manager en zijn teamleider
Description:
In deze dag ga je aan de slag met het thema organisatieleiderschap:
 - Waar komen we vandaan?
 - Successen en teleurstellingen
 - Waar gaan we naartoe? (team / organisatie)
 - Wat is daar voor nodig?

Title: Leading Effective Meetings
Description:
"This course equips associates with tools and techniques to effectively conduct meetings.
 
Learning objectives for the course include: identify the difference between an ineffective and effective meetings, learn how pitfalls in meetings can be prevented, learn proper steps to prepare for meetings, learn how to handle challenging meeting situations, learn intervention techniques to resolve problems and keep meetings on track, demonstrate increased effectiveness of leading meetings, and utilize the tools provided for conducting effective meetings."

Discover more about Intermediate MicroStrategy and IDW!
This class will be held Room 4 9th Floor. Discover how to extract decision driving metrics and start impressing your peers and superiors. You will learn the foundational concepts needed to design Microstrategy reports through the use of the Item Data Warehouse (IDW). IDW provides a number of report types that focus on providing point-of-sale (POS) information. The class provides ample opportunities to practice designing reports and organizing the data prior to extract. Attendees are encouraged to bring report ideas to get value added benefits from attending; and it makes for an interesting class.Language: English

Location: Either Quincy or Carlisle support offices.

Title: Fresh Packaged Meat: Intro and Cold Chain Management GC
Description:
When it comes to Fresh Packaged Meat, COLD is the key to fresh product!

Did you know that bacteria shortens the shelf life of Fresh Packaged Meat and that COLD is the enemy of bacteria? That's why we need to maintain the Cold Chain by:
- Moving product from the trailer to the meat cooler as soon as it's delivered
- Keeping cooler doors in good repair and closed when not in use
- Limiting the amount of time meat moves through the prep room to the sales cases to ten minutes or less.

That's how we can ensure that our customers have a great experience every time they shop our Meat Departments.


Language: English

Need help? Click here

Keywords: FPM, CRM, Case Ready Meat, optimum temperature

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Interviewing Skills - Laws Governing the Interview Process
Description:
In "Interviewing Skills - Laws Governing the Interview Process," you will focus on laws that govern the interviewing process. You will learn how to comply with laws regarding employee interviewing and selection, including those treating Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO), pregnancy discrimination, disabilities, and immigration status. Finally, you will explore the provisions, guidelines, and terms associated with each law and learn how to function within the parameters of the law.

(2 Hours)

Title: Leading for Optimal Performance
Description:
"This course helps leaders improve their roles as coaches and developers of team skills.  Leaders learn how to maximize involvement, productivity, motivation, and growth.
 
Learning objectives for the course include: learn the dynamics and benefits of working as a team; use the characteristics that all teams share to create a profile of the team; discover the challenges your team faces in each of the four stages of team development; learn the critical team success factors—purpose, process, communication, commitment, involvement, and trust—that drive team performance; demonstrate increased ownership of team performance by assessing and taking responsibility for improving team effectiveness and performance; and focus on high-priority actions and strategies that directly support the organization’s goals."
